sentence: Before we get to questions, I ’ll summarize today ’s policy action by the Federal Open Market Committee  and then I ’ll place the Committee ’s policy decision in the context of our economic outlook and our collective judgment regarding the appropriate path of monetary policy .

sentence: As indicated in the statement r eleas ed earlier this afternoon, the Committee  is maintaining the highly accommodative policies that we initiated at previous meetings .

sentence: We decided to keep the target range for the f ederal funds r ate at 0 to ¼ percent , and we continue to anticipate that eco nomic conditions are likely to warrant exceptionally low levels of the f ederal funds r ate at least through late 2014.

sentence: Our program to extend the average maturity of the Federal Reserve’ s securit y holdings —announced in September —will continue as scheduled.

sentence: Each of these policy actions is intended to foster accommodative financial conditions that support the economic recovery in a context of price stability .

sentence: In conjunction with today ’s meeting, FOMC participants —the 5 B oard members and the 12 R eserve Bank presidents —submitted their individual economic projections and policy assessments for the years 2012 to 2014 and over the long run.

sentence: April 25, 2012 Chairman Bernanke’s Press Conference  FINAL    2 of 23  Labor market conditions have improved in recent months , with the unemployment rate having fallen nearly a percentage point since August .

sentence: However, at 8.2 percent, the unemployment rate remains elevated .

sentence: Actually , we had a very good discussion of that at the meeting be cause it is an important issue , trying to assess how much of the change in employment is structural, how much is cyclical , and so on.

sentence: There is , in fact , a downw ard trend in labor participation in the United States .
reason: This sentence is dovish because a downward trend in labor participation suggests a weaker economy, which often leads to lower interest rates or other expansionary monetary policies to stimulate growth.

sentence: It comes from , first , the fact that we ’re no longer getting increased participation from women; f emale participation has leveled out .
reason: This sentence is neutral because it simply states a fact about female participation in the economy without expressing any judgment or opinion on US monetary policy.

sentence: And , secondly , because, as the society ages , and also for other reasons, male participation has been declining over  time .
reason: This sentence is neutral because it does not express any opinion, positive or negative, about US monetary policy. It simply states a fact about male participation declining over time.

sentence: So there is a downward trend that we have to take into account .
reason: This sentence is dovish because it suggests a need to consider a potential decrease in interest rates or a more expansionary monetary policy, indicated by the "downward trend" mentioned.

sentence: The participants at the meeting, at least some of them , suggested, though, that a good bit of the decline in participation that we ’ve seen in the last few years does represent cyclical April 25, 2012 Chairman Bernanke’s Press Conference  FINAL    21 of 23  factors .
reason: This sentence is neutral because it simply reports on the views expressed by some participants at a meeting, without expressing any personal opinion or bias towards US monetary policy.

sentence: Much of it is young people , for example, who presumably are not out of the labor force indefinitely , but, given the weak job market, they are going to school or doing something else rather than working .
reason: This sentence is dovish because it suggests a preference for policies that stimulate economic growth and reduce unemployment, such as keeping interest rates low to encourage young people to enter the labor force.

sentence: So one possibility and one reason why the unemployment rate may not fall as quickly going forward is that as the economy strengthens, as the labor market strengthens, many of these folks are going to come back in the labor force looking for wor k, which I think would be a good thing .

sentence: But we ’ll just have to see .
reason: This sentence is neutral because it does not express any opinion, judgement, or bias towards US monetary policy. It simply suggests a wait-and-see approach, indicating no preconceived notions or preferences.

sentence: But I do think— I think I would agree with the argument that a significant part of the decline over and above the downward trend in the participation rate is reflecting cyclical factors a nd should reverse when the economy gets stronger .
reason: This sentence is neutral because it neither supports nor criticizes US monetary policy. Instead, it objectively discusses the potential causes of a decline in the participation rate and suggests a reversal when the economy strengthens.
